citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The program of veterinary care indicates an annual schedule for vaccines, fecal testing and bloodwork (CBC/Chemistry)
for adult bovines. The last documented veterinary care for "Boots", an adult bovine, are vaccines administered over a year
ago on 18 January 2023. Failure to follow protocols in the program of veterinary care does not give appropriate authority
to the attending veterinarian and may negatively impact animal health by not providing preventive care and missing
subclinical disease processes. Each exhibitor shall assure that the attending veterinarian has appropriate authority to
ensure the provision of adequate veterinary care.
Correct by 26 April 2024.

The metal bin storing sweet feed has a moderate amount of rust forming on the lower 1/3 of the interior walls and bottom
surfaces. The food grossly appears normal. Food storage receptacles that are rusty cannot be properly cleaned or
sanitized and may contribute to food contamination. Food storage receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary at all
times.
Correct by 26 April 2024.

The current pest control program for flies consists of multiple fly traps hung around the primary enclosure of the bovine
and a topical repellant that can be applied to the animal. During inspection, the animal was observed many times shaking
its head, rubbing its face on the railing and raising its front limbs to rid itself of multiple flies on its legs and face. An
ineffective pest control program may contribute to disease transmission and discomfort of the animal. A pest control
program must be in place that is effective in controlling insects such as flies for the safety and comfort of the animal.
Correct by 26 April 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The program of veterinary care indicates an annual schedule for vaccines, fecal testing and bloodwork (CBC/Chemistry) 
for adult bovines. The last documented veterinary care for "Boots", an adult bovine, are vaccines administered over a year 
ago on 18 January 2023. Failure to follow protocols in the program of veterinary care does not give appropriate authority 
to the attending veterinarian and may negatively impact animal health by not providing preventive care and missing 
subclinical disease processes. Each exhibitor shall assure that the attending veterinarian has appropriate authority to 
ensure the provision of adequate veterinary care.  
 
Correct by 26 April 2024. 
3.129(b) 
   
Feeding. 
The metal bin storing sweet feed has a moderate amount of rust forming on the lower 1/3 of the interior walls and bottom 
surfaces. The food grossly appears normal. Food storage receptacles that are rusty cannot be properly cleaned or 
sanitized and may contribute to food contamination. Food storage receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary at all 
times. 
 
Correct by 26 April 2024. 
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
The current pest control program for flies consists of multiple fly traps hung around the primary enclosure of the bovine 
and a topical repellant that can be applied to the animal. During inspection, the animal was observed many times shaking 
its head, rubbing its face on the railing and raising its front limbs to rid itself of multiple flies on its legs and face. An 
ineffective pest control program may contribute to disease transmission and discomfort of the animal. A pest control 
program must be in place that is effective in controlling insects such as flies for the safety and comfort of the animal. 
 
Correct by 26 April 2024.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
